item.title: Teaching 3D Through Blender
item.description: How it all began More than a decade ago, I chose to take Art as an A-Level subject. In recent years, conversations with my junior college art teacher about art education and the role of technology in art-making led to some realisations: 3D software is largely absent from the art curriculum. Teachers aren’t really familiar with 3D software or what it can do. Some students pick up Blender by themselves and make artwork despite a steep learning curve.

item.title: Tyflow Experiments
item.description: Experiments with 3D Physics and Particle Simulations I’d used 3DS Max professionally every day for a couple of years, but still barely scratched the surface of what it could do. These experiments with Tyflow are by-products of deepening my technical and artistic skills, by learning more about 3D particle systems, physics simulations, and animation. I enrolled in the Tyflow Basecamp in 2020 and thoroughly enjoyed learning and making these.
